title: Create spritesheet packer to combine individual PNGs into texture atlas
description: Build a tool that packs all individual sprite PNGs (from assets/sprites/) into a single spritesheet/texture atlas image. This improves rendering performance by reducing texture binds. Include metadata generation with UV coordinates for each sprite. Support configurable padding and max dimensions.
notes:
Completed spritesheet packer tool:
- Reads sprites from sprite-atlas.json
- Loads individual PNG files from assets/sprites/
- Packs using shelf-packing algorithm (sorts by height for efficiency)
- Generates sprite-atlas.png with configurable padding (default 2px)
- Outputs to power-of-two dimensions (max 2048x2048)
- Updates sprite-atlas.json with UV coordinates (pixel + normalized)
- Shows efficiency stats and packing summary
- Added npm script: npm run pack-sprites
- Added canvas dependency to package.json
File: generate-spritesheet.js

title: Add UV coordinate rendering support to sprite renderer
description: Update sprite-renderer.js shaders and rendering pipeline to use UV coordinates from sprite atlas. Texture loading is already done in texture-manager.js. Implement proper UV mapping for both individual and packed atlas modes. Support rendering sprite regions from packed textures.
notes:
Completed UV coordinate rendering support:
- Sprite renderer already had full UV support (u0,v0,u1,v1)
- Added applySpriteUVs() method to texture-manager.js
- Added createSprite() factory method for easy sprite creation from atlas
- Automatically handles both individual and packed atlas modes
- Sets proper UV coordinates based on atlas mode
- Individual mode: uses full texture (0,0,1,1)
- Packed mode: uses UV coords from atlas data (u0,v0,u1-u0,v1-v0)
Game code can now use: textureManager.createSprite('player', x, y)
All rendering infrastructure complete for atlas support.
